title: Split release.sh into prepare and finalize scripts
description:
The current release.sh has a natural pause point: after creating the PR (human reviews, CI runs) and before merging. Split into two scripts:

1. release-prepare.sh: Validate on dev branch, optionally bump version, sync beads, create release branch, push, create PR targeting main. Outputs PR URL/number.

2. release-finalize.sh <pr-number>: Wait for CI, merge PR, tag main, create GitHub release, return to dev.

Background: The original release.sh tried to push directly to main which is protected. It was rewritten in v6.0.0-Beta.7.0 as a single script with gh pr checks --watch, but two scripts is cleaner — there's a natural human checkpoint between prepare and finalize.
close_reason: Resolved differently: single script with --after-ci flag instead of splitting into two scripts

title: Implement BMAD project settings file (.claude/bmad.local.md)
description:
Create .claude/bmad.local.md with YAML frontmatter for per-project BMAD configuration. Settings from upstream core/module.yaml and bmm/module.yaml:

- user_name: what agents call the user
- communication_language: chat language
- document_output_language: doc output language
- output_folder: base output directory (default: _bmad-output)
- project_name: project name for artifacts
- user_skill_level: beginner/intermediate/expert
- planning_artifacts: where PRDs, briefs, architecture docs go
- implementation_artifacts: where sprint docs go
- project_knowledge: where long-term docs go (default: docs/)

File format: .claude/bmad.local.md with YAML frontmatter (auto-gitignored by Claude Code). Agents read this at activation to know where to write artifacts and how to communicate.

This is essential for agent-as-service architecture — the settings file is the shared coordination mechanism between independent BMAD agents.

title: Sync workflow fails: cannot push badge updates to protected main branch

The latest failure shows upstream core is at v6.0.0-Beta.8, but the badge commit was rejected. This also explains why the 'Synced with BMAD-METHOD' workflow badge shows a red failure state on the README.

Two sub-problems:
1. Workflow cannot push to main — needs to either create a PR, or run on dev instead
2. Badge URLs in README point to main branch, so they show stale versions until a release merge

Options to fix:

B. Change workflow to create a PR instead of direct push

title: Fix Last synced date: only update when upstream version actually changes
description:
scripts/update-readme-version.ts always sets Last synced to today's date, even when the upstream version hasn't changed. After bmp-t5o creates the multi-source table, each row will have its own Last Synced column.

Fix: Only update a source's "Last Synced" date when its .upstream-version-* file content actually changed.

Approach (recommended): Use git log to find when each version file was last modified:
  git log -1 --format=%ai -- .upstream-version-core | cut -d' ' -f1

This gives the date of the last commit that touched the version file. No extra tracking files needed.

Alternative: Compare version before/after in the script, but this only works during a single run and doesn't handle historical dates.

Files to modify:
- scripts/update-readme-version.ts — use git log date for each source's Last Synced column

Depends on: bmp-t5o (table format must exist first)

title: Update sync workflow to auto-update module badges
description:
The sync workflow (.github/workflows/sync-upstream.yml) has 5 jobs: check-core, check-tea, check-bmb, check-cis, check-gds. Only check-core has an "Update badge JSON" step (lines 41-56). The other 4 jobs are missing badge updates.

Pattern (from check-core lines 41-56):
  - name: Update badge JSON
    if: steps.compare.outputs.changed == 'true'
    run: |
      cat > .github/badges/upstream-version-{id}.json <<EOF
      { "schemaVersion": 1, "label": "{Label} Module", "message": "$UPSTREAM", "color": "blue" }
      EOF
      git config user.name "github-actions[bot]" ...
      git add ... && git commit ... && git push

- check-tea → .github/badges/upstream-version-tea.json, label "TEA Module"
- check-bmb → .github/badges/upstream-version-bmb.json, label "BMB Module"

- check-gds → .github/badges/upstream-version-gds.json, label "GDS Module"

title: Research: how plugin agents reference external data files
description:
Determine how Claude Code plugin agents can reference and load external data files on demand.

Key questions:
1. Can agent .md files use @import or similar directives to pull in files at runtime?
2. Does \${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT} work inside agent instructions for file paths?
3. What is the mechanism for an agent to "fetch" a file only when needed (not pre-loaded)?
4. Can agents reference files outside the plugin directory (e.g., in ~/.claude/projects/)?

Expected output: Working examples of agents loading external files. Document what works and what does not.

Context: BMAD upstream agents have "sidecar memory" — per-agent knowledge files they read/write. We need our plugin agents to load these on demand without polluting the auto-loaded context.
